column1: Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Heading to $160 on Video Capabilities
column3: InvestorPlac - Stock Market News, Stock Advic & Trade TipsMak excus to not likeFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) and avoid FB stock is just plain dumb. Ahead of the company' fourth-quart earn report, I gave FB stock a Strong Buy rate with a 12-monthpric target of $150. With the earn report now in behind us, I'm inclin to rais that target to $160.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockIndeed, FB stock is no bargain when share are near all-tim highs, but the company' revenu growth engin are certain to significantli impact the bottom line. Although manag didn't scale back on plan to increas capit spending, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, who said the social media giant wa aim for shorter-form content, ha made clear that FB intend to domin video, which is where the bulk of it capex will go.And, that spend ha alreadi begun.Whi Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) Stock Could Fli to $1,000 in 2017Last week Facebook hire Mina Lefevre, former head of script develop atViacom, Inc.(NASDAQ:VIA). Thi hire can onli be for one reason: to increas Facebook' transit toward develop origin content. Contrari to popular opinion, Zuckerberg is not push Facebook to becom a televis network, nor doe he envis the compani compet withNetflix, Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX). Hi drive to becom a "video-first" compani ha everyth to do with sell more ads.From my vantag point, the reason Facebook must spend money is becaus it ha begun to experi a problem thatTwitt Inc(NYSE:TWTR) craves: It ha run out of ad space on it news feeds. But, Facebook doesn't want to sacrific the user experi without first know what sort of video user will want to see - and how to make them less intrusive.To that end, Lefevre, whose track record at Viacom-own MTV Network includ produc teen-focus content, is a solid hire. To the extent Facebook' shorter-form content can put it into the realm ofAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOGL) advertis juggernaut YouTube, it would have been money well spent.7 Stock to Sell or Short Befor the Bear StrikeIn that regard, given Zuckerberg' Midas-lik qualities, it would be a mistak to avoid FB stock sole on the fear of high capex. It would make more sens to focu on the return Facebook can realiz from it investments.Bottom Line for FB StockFacebook - as it promis in the third quarter - ha signal that it will be in a period of transition. Investors, however, are now take their time to see how the increas spend balanc out with management' warn of slow ad growth. While thi might put FB stock in limbo, now is also the time to look at the big picture. And my crystal ball say to own FB stock, don't trade it, and wait for $160.A of thi writing, Richard Saintvilu did not hold a posit in ani of the aforement securities.Mor From InvestorPlace7 Dividend Stock for the Retir You DeserveWhi Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) Stock Could Fli to $1,000 in 20177 Stock Warren Buffett Is Buy or SellingTh postFacebook Inc (FB) Stock Head to $160 on Video Capabilitiesappear first onInvestorPlace.

column1: Fidelity Investments' Revenue And Profit Rose In 2016
column3: Known for manag million of retir accounts, colleg save plan and regular taxable-invest accounts, Fidel Invest on Thursday said 2016 revenu rose 3.4% to $15.9 billion, a record for the privat held company.Th combin of revenu growth and slightli lower expens produc a record profit of $3.5 billion. That wa an increas of 19.5% over 2015' $3 billion in oper income.makeAd('4','300x250','mktsnews','vanguard','','');"Al busi contribut to our strong results," a Fidel spokesman said.Th 2016 profit increas revers a profit declin in 2015, when profit fell $325 million, or 9.8%, from 2014' $3.282 billion."Fidel is profitable, strong, innov and driven to growth," said Jim Lowell, editor-in-chief of Fidel Investor, an independ newsletter. "That' not true for mani financi servic companies."Th 2015 profit eros wa caus by spend on staf and technolog to compet with tough rivals.Oper expens fell slightli to $12.35 billion in 2016 from $12.4 billion the year before."Th slowdown in expens is becaus Fidel is start to see the benefit in Abigail' (Johnson) leadership," Lowel said. One way she ha cut spend is by central functions, elimin redund in inform technolog and compliance. "There' more efficiency," Lowel said.Across all of it stock mutual funds, technolog wa Fidelity' largest sector as of Jan. 31 with a 20.3%, accord to Morningstar Inc.Fidelity' top U.S. hold wereApple(AAPL),Facebook(FB),Amazon(AMZN),Alphabet(GOOGL) andMicrosoft(MSFT).Apple' stock ha surg 22% sinc shortli after the election. It ha a so-so 76 Composit Rate from IBD. Facebook ha a 90 Comp Rate and is trade near it all-tim high after break out of a cup-with-handl base in late January. Amazon ha risen 12% thi year, ha a 76 Comp Rating, and ha form a cup-with-handl base with a buy point of 843.94. Alphabet' Comp Rate is 69. Microsoft ha a weak 60 Comp Rating. It ha uptrend sinc June.99 is the highest possibl Comp Rating, which is on a scale from 1-99.Fidel also report a record $5.7 trillion in investor asset under administr (AUA), up 10.6% from year-end 2015.Total discretionari and nondiscretionari asset flow for the year wa $218.9 billion, up 15% from 2015 flow.Discretionari flow includ flow to and from manag accounts, mutual funds, exchang trade fund and collect invest trusts.Nondiscretionari flow goe to and from invest not manag by Fidelity, such as other firms' mutual fund and individu securities.At year-end, Fidel servic 27.5 million member of workplac retir plans. It servic anoth 8.9 million retail households, plu 8.7 million institut accounts.Thos total were 6%, 6.8% and 4.1% higher, respectively, than at year-end 2015.Fidel mutual fund manag found it harder to beat their peer in 2016. Fidel mutual fund beat 58%, 68% and 70% of their peer for the trail one-, three- and five-year period that end Dec. 31. They outperform 72% of their peer in the one- and three-year period and 71% of their peer in the five-year span.Still, the outperform rate wa high. "To beat 58% of your peer and have that as a bad year - most fund compani would kill for that number," said newslett editor Lowell. "The falloff reflect the difficult time activ manag had dure the six-week Trump (inspired) market run-up. Odd are they'll be back to outperform 70% or more in 2017. That is excellent."Th annual report is a must-read mainli for Fidel employees, who control 51% of the vote stock, while the Johnson famili control the other 49%.Abigail Johnson is chairwoman of parent compani FMR. She succeed her father, "Ned" Edward C. Johnson III, late last year, shortli befor her 55th birthday. Ned Johnson had been chairman sinc 1977.Fidel wa found by Abigail' grandfather, Edward C. Johnson II, in 1946. Hi father, Samuel Johnson, work in the famili dri good busi at the C.F. Hovey depart store.Abigail' brother, 52-year-old Edward C. Johnson IV, is presid of Fidelity' Pembrok Real Estat division.Go forward, a key challeng for Fidel is persuad custom - especi mutual fund investor - of the valu of activ management. "Broad indic are hold fair or fulli valu stock (after the long market run-up)," Lowel said. "Activ manag can look at which stock have the best cash flow, best defens characteristics, best growth opportunities, rather than buy bundl of high-pric stock passively."Behind The 2016 ImprovementFormally, the annual report is for Fidel Financi Services, which consist of Fidel Invest and the other financi servic line of parent compani FMR. It exclud FMR' nonfinanci busi such as it hotel and real estat operations.Fidel ha lag rival Vanguard in attract net new money from shareholders.In 2016, Fidel saw the second-largest net outflow from mutual funds, as sharehold hit the firm with $24.5 billion in net redemptions, accord to Morningstar Inc. That left Fidel with $1.2 trillion in mutual fund total net assets. That asset count reflect open-end mutual fund and exclud money market fund and fund of funds.Fidelity' mutual fund outflow wa exceed onli by Franklin Templeton Investments' $43.2 billion in net outflow. Franklin Templeton had $378.7 billion in total net assets.Net inflow to passiv run Fidel fund - mainli exchang trade fund - reduc it combin mutual-fund-and-ETF net outflow by about $1 billion.Wheth it wa flow just to mutual fund or to fund plu ETFs, sharehold larg had low cost on their minds. That made index mutual fund and ETF popular destin for net inflow. "Bi far, 2016 belong to Vanguard," Morningstar editor Tom Lauricella and senior analyst Alina Lami note in a recent report. "The low-cost juggernaut domin the flow landscap to a remark degree."Vanguard drew net inflow to it mutual fund that vastli outpac it rival firms'. Vanguard lure in a net $182.997 billion to it mutual funds.Al other mutual fund complex with inflow - there were 314 if them - had combin net inflow of $151 billion.Vanguard also attract $94.26 billion in net inflow to it ETFs.Still, Fidel had bright spots. Investor pour $37.2 billion in net inflow into passiv run Fidel mutual fund and ETFs. The troubl wa that investor yank a net $60.5 billion from Fidelity' activ run fund and ETFs.And three Fidel portfolio were among the 12 top stock mutual fund of 2016 in term of gather net inflow. Now-$111.4 billion Fidel 500 Index Fund (FUSEX) pull in a net $7.3 billion, fourth best. Sixth best wa now-$5 billion Fidel SAI U.S. Larg Cap Index (FLCPX), which drew in a net $4.4 billion. And 11th best wa now-$4.3 billion Fidel SAI U.S. Qualiti Index (FUQIX), which attract a net $3.2 billion.Money Market FundsIn addition, a trio of Fidel money market fund had massiv net inflow, which are not reflect in the Morningstar flow data for long-term funds.Fidel Institut Govern (FIGXX) pull in $74.8 billion in net inflow. Fidel Govern Money Market Fund (SPAXX) drew a net $37.7 billion. And Fidel Govern Cash Reserv (FDRXX) pull in a net $21.3 billion.Industrywide, money market fund inflowwa driven by investor uncertainty. Investor are unsur how market will respond to Presid Trump' policies, action by the new Congress, the strong dollar, expect addit interest-r hike by the Feder Reserv and global polit events, Tom Roseen, head of research servic for Lipper, told IBD.Anoth reason for volatil flow into and in some case out from money market fund is the new Secur and Exchang Commiss rule requir certain money market fund to impos redempt fee and limit to discourag sharehold exit in time of market stress, Roseen says.Th fund with net inflow hold government-issu debt. Refer to as govern money market funds, fund in that group are gener exempt from the gates-and-fe requirement. In turn, that make them popular with investor who do not want their abil to exit the fund to be limit or subject to penalti fees.RELATED:Ar Fidelity' Recent Stock Buy And Sell Retir Account Hot Sauce?Vanguard Net Fund Inflow Dwarf It Peers' In 2016Vanguard Drew The Lion' Share Of 2016' Mutual Fund Net Inflow

column1: Should I Buy General Motors Company (GM) Stock? 3 Pros, 3 Cons

Well, to see, let' take a look at 3 pro and con on Gener Motors:3 Pro On GM StockMomentum: For the past two years, Gener Motor ha post record earnings, net revenues, EBITDA and free cash flows. As forlast year, revenu increas by 9.2% to $166.4 billion and free cash flow came to $6.9 billion, up $4.7 billion from the previou year.7 Tech Stock That Could Implod at Ani MinuteThen again, Gener Motor ha continu to pump out popular cars, with global sale at 10 million (make the compani the No. 3 player). Keep in mind that the compani sell more in China than ani country, includ the U.S.But GM ha also been judici with discount and promotions. For the most part, GM is focus on make sure it make profits, not just on increas marketshare.Innovation: One of the hottest categori in technolog is the auto industry, as seen with the effort with oper likeAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL, NASDAQ:GOOG),Appl Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) andTesla Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA). For example, the compani is test over 40 autonom Bolt EVs. But there are also some other innovations, like Maven. Accord toGM: "With more than 25 million custom around the world project to use some form of share mobil by 2020, Maven is a key element of our strategi to chang ownership model in the automot industry."It' import to note that GM ha the advantag of leverag it experi with OnStar, which ha been around for two decades. In fact, dure thi time, the system ha log about1.5 billion custom interactions.Yield & Valuation: GM ha certainli been sharehold friendly. Last year, the compani return a hefti $4.8 billion - in a combin of share buyback and dividends. In fact, GM stock ha a nice yield of 4.1%.But the valuat is also attractive. Consid that the forward price-to-earn ratio is at a lowli 6.1X. True, thi may be deserv for a compani that is show declin growth. But as for Gener Motors, the compani expect to increas the top line for 2017.In other words, the stock doe look like a great valu play right now.3 Con on GM StockCompetition: The environ is brutal. With this, the compani were abl to realiz signific cost save and also hit a global sale number of nearli 10 million last year.Although, accordingFiat SpA(ADR)(OTCMKTS:FIATY) CEO Sergio Marchionne, an automak may need to reach level of15 million car sold annual to be competitive! The reason is that R&D will inevit increas becaus of the enorm cost of new technologies.A a result, a compani like GM may have littl choic but to look for a similar allianc or a transform acquisition, which would definit be riski and expensive.Politics: The elect of Donald Trump is a wild card for the auto industry. If there is a border tax, thi could hurt GM becaus of it substanti product in Mexico. Actually, about 20% of light product is in the country. So if there is a border tax, it could mean higher price in the U.S. - and yes, lower sales. Accord to theWal Street Journal: "Even a more modest border tax under consider would wipe out a quarter of GM' region profit."Glob Issues:Whil the market in China and North America have been robust for GM, there ha been much soft in mani other areas, such as in Europ and South America. Granted, there are sign of improv - but the progress ha been fairli slow. For example, in South America, GM ha been abl to cut back on the losses. It also doe not help that England ha enact the Brexit, which ha caus a lot of uncertainty. As a result, GM lost $300 million in Europ last year and it appear there will not be break-even until 2018. To put thing into perspective, the compani ha not seen a profit in the region sinc 2000!Bottom Line On GM StockPerhap the biggest issu face GM stock is the uncertainti regard Trump' trade actions. Although, given the import of the auto industri to the US economy, it doe seem reason that ani move will like be taken with care. There are some question about whether or not they will be abl to monet that veri well, and what that might look like, becaus me give you $5 becaus you bought me lunch the other day, they don't realli take anyth on that.Priestley:No, they don't. What were the results?Lewis:Overall, Alphabet' revenu came in at about $26.1 billion for Q4, up 22% year over year, which beat analysts' estim of $25.3 billion. Earn per share came in at $7.56, slightli lower than analysts' project of $7.63 per share. Aggreg cost per click, or CPCs, as they'r commonli known, wa down 15% year over year. Thi is not realli a surprise. Thi is a stori that' been play out for a long time. CPC have been driven down becaus the effect of mobil ad isn't necessarili quit the same as it is for desktop. But for the longest time, Googl ha been abl to make it up on volume. And investor have been OK with that, becaus their core internet busi just print money for them.Someth that is interest with them and the Other Bet segment is, they spun out Waymo, which is their autonom drive segment. Ruth Porat provid some commentari on what they'r basic do with Waymo as a blueprint for what they will continu to be do with Other Bets. As we, in the next coupl quarters, over the next year, continu to get more inform about Waymo, I think we can look at that specif busi segment and see the path for what' go to be go on for some of the Other Bet as they continu to matur and eventu see monetization. So, not a ton to report with Other Bet stuff, but at least we have someth that we can start to track for what the company' ambit might be.Priestley:Absolutely. It look like they'r move forward with that. Wa there anyth els in the number that stood out to you in the earn call?Lewis:I think some of the thing that peopl need to keep in mind with thi report, becaus the stock wa down after hours, I think as of tape thi morning, they were down 40 or 50 basi points, so not a crazi reaction like 3% that we saw after hour yesterday, but still down, I think peopl might be scratch their head a littl bit with some of the tax stuff they saw. Prior to the report, the compani wa trade at all-tim highs. It' trade up for a while. I think it' somewher in the teen in the last year or so. So, there' that. And also, Alphabet doe not provid detail quarterli guidance. Most compani do offer up that guidance, and analyst creat their own model base on those numbers, those line items, and they have their put and take to tweak it slightly. But becaus Alphabet doesn't give those baselin expectations, the likelihood of actual number be differ than analyst expect is slightli higher than it would be for other companies. So, the market' reaction is always, I think, gener go to be a littl bit sharper than what we might see for a compani that doe offer standard guidance.Priestley:Yeah, becaus they have noth readi to peg their estim to.Lewis:Yeah. Not have that as a crutch can just add some unpredict to things. I think that' the way you have to think about it.Priestley:Ani other littl gems?Lewis:Outsid of the numbers, someth that caught my eye that I think is a great point, and realli underscor the import of read compani confer calls, and not just reli on the number that you see report and the quick earn take you'll see online: Mark Mahaney from RBC Capit Marketsin the Q&A section of the call ask thi realli great question, and I think it point to a loom risk for Alphabet, and I just want to highlight that for listeners. He said, "It look to me like Googl devic are be outsold 10 to 1 or someth like that in most homes. It' immateri now, but you could see you in five year there' a new voic search interact interfac and it' not Googl in the home. That could be a real challeng for the company." And he wa basic positing, "What are you guy do about all of the virtual-assist and smart-hom devices?"Priestley:Yeah, great question.Lewis:Yeah. And Sundar Pichai, Googl CEO, he gave that gener posit answer, talk about the invest the compani is make and how they'r work toward voic search, and how they'r tri to meet consum in everi situat that they might be use voic search, whether it be phones, TV, homes, cars, whatever. But really, at it core, Mahaney' question is get at thi idea of: Amazon' Echo devic are sell like hotcakes. If the instal base for them, or realli ani other virtual assistant, get massive, and consum start use those devic for the type of thing and the purpos that peopl are gener use Googl mobil and desktop search for, what doe that do for your business? I don't want to be alarmist with ani of this. I am an Alphabet shareholder, I realli love the company. But I think he make a good point. Earlier thi month, actually, at an ad industri conference, there wa anAmazonVP talk about some of the capabl and some of the opportun that Amazon might explore. That led some analyst to specul that the compani might be interest in explor paid search with it Alexa product. Thi is not someth that is a next-quarter, next-year issue. But over the next five to 10 years, we need to keep an eye on how peopl are use search, and how peopl are use home assist or virtual assistants. Because, if we see that slowli eat into what would otherwis be desktop or mobil search, you have to wonder about how that might impact Google' core business, and realli what print money for them and allow them to fund all of these other projects.Priestley:Yeah. And also, which product they'r using. If everybodi start adopt the Googl Nest, then they'r good.Lewis:Yeah. If peopl are use Nest or Googl Assistant, then yeah, not a huge problem, that will keep them within that ecosystem. If they are use product that don't lean on Googl search, and you have platform that are abl to monet that search, Googl might get crowd out a littl bit. Again, Googl did $26 billion in revenu thi quarter. The vast major of that wa onlin ads. It' a huge market. I think people' more in-depth searching, or more research-bas stuff, is alway go to be on desktop or mobile. You can onli glean so much from audio. But if you want the quick answer on someth -- say you want to know who wa the fifth presid of the Unit State -- you can find that out with a voic search, and not realli have to worri about be on mobil or desktop. And that' less impress for Googl Ad Search. So, it' someth to keep in mind. Again, thi is a five, 10-year risk. But, just, investors, keep an eye on what' go on with the virtual assist market, becaus it' someth that could impact Alphabet down the road.Priestley:That' realli interesting. I will hand the baton back to you. [laughs]Lewis:Oh, you'r go to let me wrap up? That' so magnanim of you.Well, listeners, that doe it for thi episod ofIndustri Focus. column1: Exploiting The Amateur Investor's Edge: Investing In What You Know To Discover Bargains And Earn Conservative, Outsized Returns
column3: ByMichael Seeley:"Buy what you know about is a veri sophist strategi that mani profession have neglect to put into practice."[i]- Peter LynchTh author isn't sure just how descript the abov statement is when appli to institut money manag and invest analyst today. The one we have spoken to seem to have a veri detail understand of all the compani and industri they cover. The author doe believ it accur describ the averag individu stockpicker.makeArticleAd();IntroductionInvesting, as practic by the averag investor, is a game rig so the housealmostalway wins. Wall Street will take the averag investor' life savings, and will do so dispassion and unapologetically. Thi fundament understand is essenti to engag in buy and sell activ in the market."Invest is a zero-sum game. To buy a stock, someon els ha to be selling.Y are bet you know the compani better than the person that is sell it to you."[ii]- Peter LynchMak no mistak about it, buy and sell stock is a competition. It is serious, it is real, and if one is not constantli awar of thi fact and doesn't take it seriously, one is apt to be a sucker. Someon is alway tri to either sell someon els an overpr security, or they are tri to buy anoth person' underpr secur for penni on the dollar. That is what the market often is,[iii]an exchang to take advantag of the person on the other end of a transaction. Thi realiti is not alway appreciated, as one' competitor is rare seen, but it is a competit all the same, and one with real financi stakes. Everi singl time you buy or sell a stock, there is somebodi on the other side of that transact bet you are wrong, and they are bet real money on it. They are also bet they know more than you, and they are tri to exploit your ignor in the busi underli the security."Ther are rich teams, and there are poor teams, and then there' fifti feet of crap, and then there is us." - Brad Pitt' charact Billi Bean in Michael Lewis'Moneyball,speak of the Oakland AthleticsWhat' more, the game most institut money manag and Wall Street institut play is stack heavili intheirfavor. They have more resourc than the amateur investor, better industri coverage, better contacts, better access to manag teams, better technology, brilliant (and let' face it,moreintelligent) analyst with more prestigi post graduat and doctor degre from the finest institut in the country. Play a game even remot in thi machine' wheelhous is almost certain to be a disaster. The chanc are that those institut are gener on the other side of everi transact the amateur investor enter into.If the reader is not yet discouraged, he or sheshouldbe. Forget the abov fact and becom complacent, or even arrogant, will not lend the sens of humil and caution that are necessari for success stock picking. A measur ofarrogancei necessari in pick stocks, but it must alway be balanc with humil and awareness, and it is good onli when logic support by research and analysis. All of thi bring us to a harsh truth that the reader will be wise to remember."Choos individu stock without ani idea of what you'r look for is like run through a dynamit factori with a burn match. You may live, but you'r still an idiot."[iv]- Joel GreenblattIf we accept Mr. Greenblatt' statement as true, and the author is a firm believ it is true, then whi even tri to buy and sell individu securities?Well, the real truth is that buy and sell individu stock is gener onli stupid if one engag in the practic in the way almost everybodi alway does. Put anoth way, there is a right way, and then there is the way nearli everyon doe it.Th right way is the exception.Despit all the above, the amateur may still achiev result in excess of the major of the professionalsifth amateur insist on play hi or her own game on hi or her own field. To make money consist over the long term, the investor need toonlybet when the odd are in hi or her favor; in other words, onli when he or she ha anedgeov the competition.How do we do that? The author will answer the question by pose a few question of hi own:Wouldn't it be nice if undervalu compani that are profitable, with durabl competit advantag and reliabl earn streams, compani that may even be like to compound over time had like a flash light and loud nois go off to attract our attention, but onli our attent (mean most of the competit would miss the signs)?Wouldn't it be nice if we could take the thing we are best at, that we know the most about, and we could place bet on that, and even then could choos to onli bet when we were certain, or nearli certain that we will win?What we will do in thi particular articl is to identifi a specif "edge" that provid most investor a leg up over the larg financi institut and over the armi of financi analyst on Wall Street. An edg is a place where the odd are stack in your favor, through practice, knowledge, skill, time frame, or location. We will also provid real world exampl on how to exploit these edges, but first, pleas permit us an analogy, to realli drive the concept home into the reader' grey matter.Select Your Opponent…I cannot help but rememb my friend from London, in what is known as theEast End. Mr. McDonald-Smith is a fairli larg man of Jamaican descent, speak fluent Spanish due to a coupl of year live in the Dominican Republic, and is, as they say in England, quit fit. You know the type, someon with arm the size of their head where even an extra-larg shirt is in constant danger of pop it buttons? Mr. McDonald-Smith can honestli boast that he ha never been beaten in arm-wrestling. Thi feat is not overli surpris when look at him, but how is it possibl that one can have a100%success rate in anything? Surely, there is alway someon stronger, or more skilled, and even if there were no such person; doesn't everybodi just have a bad day onc in a while? In fact, Mr. McDonald-Smith is not an undef arm-wrestl becaus he is the strongest man in the world, nor is he undef becaus he is the world' most skill practition of the sport. No, the fact is that Mr. McDonald-Smith is undef due to a veri simpl strategi that is design to help him be successful.What is hi secret? It is quit simple.H never engag in a match with anybodi that he isn't absolut certain he can beat.In such a manner, he can honestli say he ha never been outmatched. He never has, and so long as he continu in hi strategy, he never will be. As he grow older, he will undoubtedli accept fewer and fewer challeng until one day he will retir complet from thi activity, undef and triumphant. Whi is thi important? Well, Mr. McDonald-Smith ha an edg in arm-wrestling. He is larg of stature. He is strong. He is fit. He is smart. And he manag hi ego. Taken as a percentage, the probabl of encount a formid oppon are quit small. On the rare occas that he meet such an opponent, Mr. McDonald-Smith gracious declin the match.Now, here' the key to the strategy: It wouldn't work in a formal arm-wrestl tournament where one wa forc to take on everi oppon place in front of him.In fact, it may be quit useless. While Mr. McDonald-Smith is like to do quit well in a tournament, and he may even advanc to the later rounds, he is unlik to win simpli becaus there is alway someon stronger, or who ha train longer and more diligently. Luckili for Mr. McDonald-Smith, he needn't ever enter such a tournament. There is no reason to outsid of ego.What is the point? Don't play if (and when) you can't win.Exampl of Util One' EdgeNow for some real-world exampl to illustr the valu of invest in what you know, and use one' individu knowledg and skill to avoid lose money, and to achiev out-siz invest returns. As the author is train as a tax CPA, these particular exampl revolv around corpor incom taxes. One needn't understand GAAP account for incom tax in order to understand the underli point (If the author had been a use car salesman, we like would have made some invest in car manufactur or rental car compani (one could have made a lot of money invest in Budget, Avis, Hertz, Dollar, etc. if they understood the business). The point is to invest in what one know and understands).It doe not take mani home run and grand slam to result in a satisfactori invest record if one doe not lose money in the process. Thi bear repeating, with emphasis. It doe not take mani home run and grand slam to result in a satisfactori invest recordif one doe not lose money in the process. That' not to say we tri to swing for the fences. Most investor equat swing for the fenc with risk, but that is not the onli way to hit a home run. When a perfect pitch come along, a well-rehears swing can result in the ball just fli off the bat with ease. Likewise, sometimes, the most conserv invest can produc the most signific results; particularli if one understand the space and can recogn the opportun and the risks. Thi also bear repeating. Sometim the most conserv invest can produc the most signific results; particularli if one understand the space and can recogn the opportun and the risks.Vonage(NYSE:VG) andSpectrum Brand Holdings(NYSE:SPB) are both exampl of the author find signal in financi statement to reveal attract invest opportunities. In both cases, our attent wa drawn by the inclus of atyp effect tax rate in the respect company' SEC filings. Becaus of our experi with account for incom tax provis in our day job, we were abl to quickli identifi and interpret these signal despit work fairli hectic schedules, and after a review of the rest of the financi statement and the companies' busi operations, market positioning, management, and outlook, were abl to open an invest in a fairli time manner, which turn out to be key, as the share appreci substanti post purchase.VonageStock High: $7.88 (01/13/2017)Recent Price: $6.88 (02/03/2017)Price Paid: $2.31; $1.71; $2.25 (01/24/2012; 5/25/12; 4/2/12)Vonag Hold Corp.i an exampl of how experi in financi statement preparation, specif the account for incom tax can lead one to a compel invest thesis.VG is a voice-ov IP ((VOIP)) commun compani (i.e. an Internet-bas telephon provider) with catchi televis advertis spot featur either someon on the beach get hit in the head with a fli box with the Vonag brand on it, or with variou person declar their independ from land line by state "thi is my last phone bill" and then crumpl it up and toss it into a massiv pile in the middl of a warehouse, suggest that everyon is do it. It wa a trendi IPO that promptli plummet and lost 80% of it market value. Having, for year dure college, use AOL' (AOL) dial-up Internet CD that came free in the mail to access the Internet, we appreci how the bargain basement telephon servic that Vonag provid could be attract to low-incom users, particularli those with non-resid famili and friends. Have also been an earli fan of Google' (GOOG) (GOOGL) Gmail chat and call featur (now call Hangouts), we and our work colleagu were alreadi adopt of the technology. We recogn that, much like AOL' dial-up CD had previously, land-bas telephon line were fast go obsolete. The Compani had paid down approxim $130M in debt, bring it leverag to about 0.5x net income, and reduc it interest expens year over year by 2/3. The Compani had a fairli clean balanc sheet, stabl revenue, new app and oversea partnerships, so good news on the horizon. Add to that a swing to signific profitability, and the Compani wa trade at a PE of less than 5x and an EV/EBITDA of 3-4x. The Compani look cheap on those metric alone, and there were no sign that busi would deterior ani time soon.So where did our edg come in? What drew our attent to Vonag wa the publish effect tax rate ((ETR)). For calendar 2011 the ETR wa a -375%, as in abenefit(anoth word for a tax gain, the recognit of which actual increas net incom rather than decreas it) and not an expense. Now, in some situations, ETR can be misleading, particularli when compani are oper near break-even, but Vonag wa profit in 2011 with pre-tax earn of $86.3M. It pay to take a look at the footnot and tax rate reconcili in such situat to see what is drive the tax benefit.W reproduc the Company' tax rate reconcili below from it 2011 Form 10-K:[v]Here we see that it wa the releas of a valuat allow ((VA)) on the defer tax asset (DTAs) that wa drive the tax benefit (A valuat allow is a fanci way of say that an asset can't be recogn becaus it is uncertain if it will ever provid a benefit to the Company). By remov a VA, the Compani is send a signal that the benefit of the asset will be recognized, and the independ auditor must agre that such a posit is reasonable. The next step then is to determin what defer tax asset the Compani is now benefit from.Again from the 2011 Form 10-K:"Our net defer tax asset primarili consist of net oper loss carri forward ("NOLs"). We are requir to record a valuat allow against our net defer tax asset if we conclud that it is more like than not that taxabl incom gener in the futur will be insuffici to util the futur incom tax benefit from our net defer tax asset (namely, the NOLs), prior to expiration. We period review thi conclusion, which requir signific manag judgment. Until the fourth quarter of 2011, we record a valuat allow fulli against our net defer tax assets.In 2011, we complet our first full year of taxabl incom and complet our budgetari process for period subsequ to 2011, which anticip continu taxabl incom in the future."[vi](Emphasisadded)To interject some commentari here, what thi mean is that, by the fourth quarter of 2011, the Compani had not onli just demonstr a pattern of profitability, but it wa project profit in the futureat leastsuffici to recogn the NOL as DTA without an offset VA. So now we know the Compani expect to continu it pattern ofsignificantprofitability, and will larg be abl to avoid pay tax dure the lifetim of the NOLs. But what exactli doe that mean? Let' continue, and rememb that the below number are shown in thousand (000s), so for example, $300,000 is realli $300million."Bas upon these factor and our sustain profit oper perform over the past three year exclud certain loss associ with our prior convert note and our Decemb 2010 debt refinancing, our evalu determin that the benefit result from our net defer tax asset (namely, the NOLs),ar like to be realiz prior to their expiration. Accordingly, we releas the relat valuat allow against our Unit State feder and Canada net defer tax assets, anda portionof the allow against our state net defer taxassetsa certain NOL may expir prior to util due to shorter util period in certain states, result in a one-tim non-cash incom tax benefit of $325,601 and a correspond net defer tax asset of $325,601 in the fourth quarter of 2011."[vii](Emphasisadded)Account and attorney love use run-on sentences. The $325Mbenefitthey are talk about recogn now that they are remov the VA is not how much incom the NOL are expect to offset, rather, it is thetax effected(think cash tax save impact) amount of U.S./Canada tax that will not have to be paid in the future. Thegrossamount of incom the NOL can offset is shown below:"A of Decemb 31, 2011, we had NOL for Unit State feder and state tax purpos of $794,714 and $423,963, respectively…"[viii]On can see thi activ occur on both the balanc sheet and the incom statement. A quick review of the NOL expir schedul in the tax footnot provid addit insight into theminimumproject profit of the Compani over the next 18 years.So what did our quick check of the footnot in the SEC file yield? Not insignificantly, we discov that the $326M taxbenefitin calendar 2011 wa due to the releas of a valuat allow on $885M of Feder net oper loss (NOLs) book as an asset on the balanc sheet. What thi means, in essence, is that the Compani wa not onli demonstr an impress return to profit in the prior year (2011), but that it also had signific expect of profit into the forese future. Gener speaking, independ auditor are reluct to sign off on such a larg tax benefit/VA releas without compel incom project and a solid histori of recent earn that are more than suffici to offset the NOLs. We have seen except to thi of course, but provid the auditor is reputable, those except are few and far between.Bottom line; all els be equal, when a compani with a $400M market capit and enterpris valu recogn a $326M GAAP gain due to the more-likely-than-not expect ofat least$885M of taxabl incom over the come years, and then add to that the PE and EV/EBITDA under 5x and veri littl leverage, it' a good bet that compani is worth a whole lot more than the current $2/share.It also may provid a competit advantag over new market entrant that must pay tax over the come decade.Th cash that would otherwis go to pay tax may be use to amort debt, invest in the business, repurchas shares, pay a dividend, or ani number of activ manag may think of to creat valu and increas earn further.With the Company' stock trade around $2 per share, and arm with the confid provid by our edg in financi statement analysi (with particular focu on the incom tax provision), and further arm with a suffici understand of the busi in which it operates, we felt safe enter a position. The result were satisfactory, as illustr in the share price chart below. Although the share dip not insignificantli immedi after our purchase, we took the opportun to increas our posit (remember, we could act with confid becaus we understood what we owned, and what the Compani and the auditor believ the futur held). The share doubl within the year, and have trend upward since.LessonsWhen a company' share are trade at an aggreg market capit of under $400M, is not heavili levered, and then that same compani recogn over $100M of annual EBITDA, $86M of pre-tax income, and on top of all that, book a $326M defer tax asset for NOLs, that is a good sign that not onli is the compani expect to earn incom equival to the gross underli NOL prior to expiration, but also coupl with a clean balanc sheet and suffici cash that the compani is worth look at more closely.Spectrum Brand Hold wa in mani way the opposit of Vonage, but our attent wa attract for much the same reasons.Spectrum Brand HoldingsRec Price: $132.76 (02/03/2017)Price Paid: $25.07 (10/19/11)"Decis to buy and sell stock should be base sole on the invest merits" - Joel GreenblattSpectrum Brand Hold own a number of household brand names, includ Rayovac Batteries, Black & Decker, Russel Hobbs, Black Flag, Georg Foreman Grills, Spectracide, Cutter, Repel, Armor All, STP, etc. SPB' debt-financed, acquisit spree in the 2000 result in a bankruptci file that wipe out sharehold in 2009. One can read more about the Company' backgroundhere.[ix]Th Compani wa still recov the follow two years, when in 2011 we notic the effect tax rate. We onli even saw that as we were look up Prestig Brand Hold (NYSE:PBH) and mistyp the ticker symbol. Incidentally, we end up enter posit in both compani (better lucki than good)."Our effect tax rate on incom from continu oper is approxim 24% and 249% for the Fiscal 2011 Quarter and Fiscal 2011 Nine Months, respectively."[x]Th impact to the tax rate reconcili for the quarter wa even more pronounced, in the event that a 249% effect tax rate wasn't enough to rais eyebrows.Thus, wherea Vonag had recogn a larg taxbenefitdu to theliftingof a valuat allowance, Spectrum wa recogn a larg taxexpense.Thi is generallynotgood. The question of cours wa why? Were earn deteriorating? Wa it mere do to a chang in control? Were there not suffici incom project go forward to offset NOLs? Read further we got more information:"At Juli 3, 2011, we are estim that at Septemb 30, 2011 we will have U.S. feder and state net oper loss carryforward of approxim $1,156 million and $1,006 million, respectively, which will expir through year end in 2032, and we will have foreign net oper loss carryforward of approxim $143 million, which will expir begin in 2011. Certain of the foreign net oper loss have indefinit carryforward periods. As mention above, limit appli to a substanti portion of the U.S. feder and state net oper loss carryforward in accord with IRC Section 382. As such, we estim that approxim $299 million of our feder and $463 million of our state net oper loss will expir unused."[xi]That last bit about the §382 limit realli just say that due to one or more chang in control (i.e. ownership transfer of more than 5% of the company, which will gener occur in a Chapter 11 bankruptci reorganization) that there is a limit to how much of the NOL may be use in ani given year, irrespect of profitability. For example, if the Compani were to earn $1.2B in fiscal 2011 (implaus we know, but we are make an illustration), Spectrum would belimitedto how much of the NOL could be use to offset that income, and so on, and so forth until the NOL expired."Th ultim realiz of our defer tax asset depend on our abil to gener suffici taxabl incom of the appropri charact in the futur and in the appropri tax jurisdictions.W establish valuat allow for defer tax asset when we estim it is more like than not that the tax asset will not be realized.W base these estim on project of futur income, includ tax plan strategies, in certain jurisdictions. Chang in industri condit and other econom condit may impact our abil to project futur income. ASC 740 requir the establish of a valuat allow when it is more like than not that some portion or all of the defer tax asset will not be realized. In accord with ASC 740, we period assess the likelihood that our defer tax asset will be realiz and determin if adjust to the valuat allow are appropriate.A a result of thi assessment, we determin that a full valuat allow is requir against the tax benefit of our net defer tax asset in the U.S., exclud certain indefinit live intangibles. In addition, certain other subsidiari are subject to valuat allow with respect to certain defer tax assets. Dure the Fiscal 2011 Quarter we decreas our valuat allow against net defer tax asset by approxim $30 million. Our total valuat allowance, establish for the tax benefit of defer tax asset that may not be realized, wa approxim $350 million and $331 million at Juli 3, 2011 and Septemb 30, 2010, respectively. Of thi amount, approxim $339 million and $300 million relat to U.S. net defer tax asset at Juli 3, 2011 and Septemb 30, 2010, respect and approxim $11 million and $31 million relat to foreign net defer tax asset at Juli 3, 2011 and Septemb 30, 2010, respectively."[xii](Emphasisadded)Th Company' footnot for fiscal 2010[xiii]rev somewhat more detail on the NOL and their expirations.Therefore, in contrast with Vonage, Spectrum did not anticip be abl to util it NOL prior to expiration, due both to §382 limit and/or insuffici taxabl incom against which to offset the NOLs. In addition, the Compani wa still fairli lever with $1.7B of long-term debt[xiv]on it balanc sheet.So whi were we interested? Well, we like the asset and brands, which were consum good with respectable, durabl competit advantages. Although not alway the market leader (e.g. Rayovac wa compet fierc with Energ and Duracel on the platform of "equal or better valu at a lower cost"), the valu proposit and barrier to entri were considerable. In addition, due to the heavi debt load which requir about $200M of annual interest payments[xv]p year, the incom tax provis wa skew the effect tax rate; therefore, net incom (and henc the PE ratio) were, if not entir worthless, not necessarili reflect of the Company' cash gener capabilities, nor the valu of the entir business."Compani that spend money like drunken sailors, especi on acquisit and real estate, are left with a huge depreci allow and a lot of debt to pay off, which give them a high cash flow/low earn profile."[xvi]Th truth wa the Compani had signific oper income[xvii]and wa throw off signific amount of cash befor interest payment and debt amortization.[xviii]Th ETR attract our attention, but upon closer inspection, we becam comfort with the Company' valu strategy, it place in the market, the growth in it earn and cash flow, it abil to servic and amort it debt, and the defens of it business. All thing considered, we initi a posit and determin to watch the year-end results[xix]closely.SPB wa trade in the $25 rang prior to our entry. SPB ha subsequ trade up to north of $130 per share. In thi case, the ETR mere attract our attent to a compel invest possibl so we could studi it further. It wa a coupl month later when the Form 10-K came out that we believ we had someth realli special. The Compani had reduc it long-term debt by $180M from $1.72B to $1.54B[xx]and net cash provid by oper activ wa $227M.[xxi]It seem clear to us that the Compani could servic it debt load, and worst-cas scenario could sell off one or more brand to de-lev further, but we didn't expect that would be necessary.Furth research into SPB prior to the share take off similarli reveal an interest arbitrag opportun via the share ofHarbing Capit Group(NYSE:HRG), where one could take advantag of the valu gap in SPB at the same time as one could take advantag in the valu gap in HRG. Thi is further discuss immedi below, and is realli an extens of the same investment.Lessons:"Th best stock to buy may be the one you alreadi own."[xxii]- Peter LynchOn should listen to Peter Lynch and use one' uniqu edg to capit on opportun in one' circl of competency.On should continu to listen to Warren Buffett and not sell out of a compani with great long-term prospects, a durabl competit advantage, and grow earnings, which wa purchas at a fair price. Just hold it forev (unless it is a cyclical)."A I studi these report now, I realiz that mani stock that I held for a few month I should have held a lot longer. Thi wouldn't have been uncondit loyalty; it would have been stick to compani that were get more and more attractive…. By abandon these great compani for lesser issues, I becam a victim of the all-too-common practic of 'pull out the flower and water the weeds'" - Peter LynchHarbing Capit GroupRec Price: $16.79 (02/02/2017)Price Paid: $4.06; $4.10; $4.01 (12/29/11; 12/29/11; 12/31/2013)In 2010,Harbing Capit Groupcontrol Russel Hobbs, and merg it with Spectrum Brands, leav HRG with a major stake in SPB. HRG also own a valuabl insur company. HRG wa own primarili byHarbing Capit Partners(NYSE:HCP), a hedg fund that made billion bet against subprim mortgag dure the credit crisis.HCP and it founder, Philip Falcone, were at the time under indict by the SEC, which alleg that Falcon had misus fund asset for person use, and that HCP had engag in unfair redempt practices, allow favor investor such as Goldman Sach to redeem partnership interests, while lock up other investor (Note these alleg were later settled). The indict had the result of temporarili depress the share of HRG, in our view, understandably, but excess given the natur of hold and oper in HRG. One may read a littl about thi arbitrag play in the comment of the abov referenc articl on Spectrum Brand Holdings, reproduc againhere.[xxiii]On may further read an articl on thi special situationhere.[xxiv]Ther wa certainli some control risk in thi arbitrag play, but dure 2011, HRG actual trade at a valu that wa less than it publicly-trad ownership in SPB, give a neg valu to the insur company. As SPB wa similarli undervalu at the time, an invest in the undervalu HRG wa anoth way to obtain the similarli undervalu share of SPB at a signific discount to their trade value. column1: Snap Just Became One of Google's Most Important Cloud Customers
column3: One of the mani interest detail reveal inSnap' S-1 file with the SEC is that it agre to a $2 billion contract with Googl Cloud in January. It ha plenti of capit to cover the expense, and if last year' growth is ani indic of what to expect, it will need to spend at least $340 million on cloud infrastructur thi year. The deal with Googl ensur that it get the lowest rate possible, so it can to make the most of it spend.Overall, it' not a bad deal for Snap, but it doe tie the compani to Googl for a long time.10 stock we like better than Alphabet (A shares)When invest genius David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip, it can pay to listen. column1: What Is Unearned Revenue, and Why Should Amazon Investors Care About It?
column3: A small line item onAmazon.com's(NASDAQ: AMZN) balanc sheet ha been grow rapidli over the past coupl years. Sinc the end of 2014, Amazon' unearn revenu liabil increas from $1.8 billion to $4.8 billion. Some investor might see a grow liabil and think that' bad news, but in fact thi is veri good news.Unearn revenu is simpli cash custom have paid to Amazon in advanc for servic it ha yet to render. For example, Prime member typic pay $99 up front for a full year of the two-day ship program. Amazon immedi take the cash and put it on it balanc sheet, but it amort the $99 of revenu over the 12 month of the membership. So it account for onli $8.25 per month in revenu per month for each Prime member. The rest of the cash receiv for Prime is held in the unearned-revenu balance.Prim growth ha been veri good over the past few years. Amazon say it ad "ten of millions" of new member last year. But Prime isn't the biggest driver of unearn revenue. More likely, Amazon Web Servic (AWS) is the biggest factor push the balanc higher.makeArticleAd();Imag source: Getti Images.Mayb last quarter wasn't so disappointingFor the first time sinc Amazon start break out AW revenu and income, the cloud-comput segment miss analysts' expectations. Sale total $3.5 billion in the fourth quarter, where analyst were expect $3.6 billion on average.But unearn revenu climb $568 million from the previou quarter. That' unusu for Amazon' fourth quarter. Usually, unearn revenu spike in the first quarter as cloud custom presum re-up short-term contract for the year.Most of Amazon' AW custom are small busi use it pay-as-you-go pricing, which allow them to quickli scale their use. The solut work well for compani with small or unpredict user bases.But a lot of AWS' money come from the big enterpris that spend hundr of million everi year on cloud computing. For those companies, with more predict usag needs, Amazon offer "reserv instances," which offer a discount if custom pay up front. column3: Amazon.com(NASDAQ: AMZN) may be lead the grow market for cloud infrastructure, butAlphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) is still put up a fight.Cloud infrastructur vendor have been crucial in enabl smaller start-ups, particularli those that are build mobil apps, to get up and run without have to worri as much about the back end. In contrast, if a company' cost structur ha a larger proport of variabl costs, those cost will scale commensur with revenue, so you don't get as much margin expansion. Semiconductor mostli shift to the OpEx model long ago, and there are onli a hand of compani that current manufactur their own chip these days.Snap is wade into unchart territori by reli on third-parti infrastructur partner at thi scale. column1: Your Snap Shares Won't Get You Any Votes
column3: One of the most interest aspect ofSnap's(NYSE: SNAP) IPO file is that the share it' offer to the public will have no vote right at all. As a result, co-found Evan Spiegel and Bob Murphi will continu to control a combin 88.6% of the compani -- 44.3% each. The share class do convert. One share of Class C is convert into one share of Class B. One share of class B is convert into one share of Class A. (No, you can't convert share the other way around.) As such, all share of Snap stock, regardless of class, will particip equal in the profit of the company.How much is a vote worth?Alphabet ha the same vote structur for it stock, with the caveat that A share have one vote, B share have 10, and C share have no vote. Facebook announc it would split it share the same way at some point in the future.Shar of Alphabet provid the best look at how much investor valu vote rights. Those will be Class C shares, and Spiegel will then be abl to exercis complet control over the company. In the meantime, there' potenti for deadlock vote between Spiegel and co-found Bob Murphy, as they each control equal-s stakes.But that' not the most concern thing about the capit structur at Snap. The onli way for the founder to lose control of the compani is if they both die. As describ in the S-1 filing, "Either of our co-founders' share of Class C common stock will automat convert into Class B common stock, on a one-to-on basis, nine month follow hi death." If that happens, the other co-found will have a control share of the votes.In other words, both founder could leav the compani but still be abl to exercis control over it.Facebook made provis to it stock split to ensur that Zuckerberg would onli control the company' vote right as long as he remain CEO.There' a provis on Alphabet' Class B sharehold that for everi Class C non-vot share they sell, they must convert one Class B share into a Class A share, and presum sell that as well. Thi segment make low-cost enterpris hardwar products, such as wireless access points, switches, routers, secur cameras, and VOIP phones, along with softwar that allow IT profession to track larg network from a singl user interface. Ubiquiti' low-cost busi model -- the compani employ almost no sale forc or servic professionals, and hire a limit number of "all-star" engin -- enabl it to produc solid wi-fi product at rock-bottom prices, and the product line caught fire in 2016. In January, however, the compani unveil a new line of advanc product aim at higher-end customers, which is the turf of IT giant such asCisco(NASDAQ: CSCO) andHP(NYSE: HPE) . The new product includ the US-16-XG Switch for $599 and a new Wave 2 access point for $349. These are much higher price point than tradit Unifi products, but still much lower than high-end access point vendor such as Cisco' Meraki ($1,399), HP' Aruba ($1,395) andBrocade's(NASDAQ: BRCD) Rucku ($1,295). Should Ubiqu make inroad into higher-end deployments, these new product could drive Ubiquiti' already-sky-high 35% oper margin even higher.Ubiqu look as if it is final make it move to disrupt legaci IT players, just as promin ventur capitalist (and former Ubiqu board member) Bill Gurley predict in 2014:"The fact that Cisco ha never had a price disruptor over 30 year seem to violat the rule of the "Innovator' Dilemma." If I had to bet on anyon pull that off it would be [Ubiqu CEO] Robert [Pera]."Airmax refreshWhil Unifi wa the star of 2016, Ubiquiti' biggest segment is still Servic Provider, which account for 59% of total revenues. Under the Airmax and Airfib brands, thi segment make high-pow radio that beam Wi-Fi over long distanc while achiev cable-lik speeds. These radio are the build block for Wireless Internet Servic Provid (WISPs) in rural and emerg market worldwide, where fiber or satellit is too expensive, and the spectrum is less cluttered. Airmax growth had stall in the past two year from it hyper-growth period a few year ago, yet still grew 15% year over year in the Septemb quarter.Ther are reason to think that 2017 could bring a reacceler for Airmax and it associ products. First, Ubiqu drop the ball somewhat when it initi releas Airmax AC, as these hyper-fast product were not backwards-compat with older Airmax M radios. That meant servic provid custom would have to refresh their entir network of radio in order to upgrade, as oppos to upgrad radio-by-radio. Thi wa fix in Decemb with the releas of new firmwar AirO 8.0, which wa no small task (it took over a year!). Second, Pera recent reveal sever new Airmax product for 2017, includ a GPON fiber product. While Ubiquiti' radio are normal use to replac fiber, Ubiqu found out that mani of it emerging-market custom can lay fiber along power line veri cheaply, and thi new product should add to their arsenals. Even more exciting, the compani reveal an entir new ASIC (application-specif integr chip) it ha develop call LTU. As Pera explained:"It' been well over 3 year in the making, and we'r go to launch it next year. And it' go to be essenti airFib multipoint. But it' go to be light-year ahead of anyth in the market, and at cost point relev to airMAX, we'r go to price it higher. The margin are go to be a lot better... we think that' go to be a realli big differenti in the market."Again, we see Ubiqu make a move to grow out of it reput as just a low-cost vendor, and into a compani that sell higher-qu (and, therefore, higher-margin) product as well.AmplifiWhil Pera & Co. are at it, whi not enter a complet new custom segment? That' what Ubiqu did thi summer with the introduct of Amplifi, a consum router that will take onNetgear's(NASDAQ: NTGR) Orbi andGoogle's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) home router. Amplifi is gettingstellar reviewsso far, and just like Unifi' access points, it might pave the way for other ancillari product for the connect home.Even though the Amplifi wa unveil last summer, it hasn't produc much revenu for Ubiqu yet. Thi is not becaus the product wasn't great, but becaus the compani wa capacity-constrain for the last half of 2016. As Pera said:"What I'm really, really, realli frustrat about, is we didn't execut on the product side. So we had demand for ten of thousand of unit out of the gate, and we'v just been slow to get these out."That is what I'd call have "champagn problems." And while Ubiqu is go up against strong competitor such as Google, Netgear, and others, the price-perform characterist of the product, as well as the secular tailwind of the connect home make me a believ that Amplifi could becom a meaning growth driver as earli as thi year.Th valuat is still reasonableEven after Ubiquiti' big move, the stock trade at a fairli reason 23 time trail earnings, which mean the market is price in decent, though not spectacular, growth from here. Still, with a disrupt busi model, a rock-solid balanc sheet, and a long runway in a secular growth industry, I think Ubiquiti' stock can exit 2017 a good deal higher than where it entered.Off from the Motley Fool: The 10 best stock to buy nowMotley Fool co-found Tom and David Gardner have spent more than a decad beat the market. column1: 3 Stocks We're Never Selling
column3: We Fool are constantli on the hunt for win stock idea that we believ will gener strong return for year on end. When we think we have identifi a win business, we like to buy it and hang on to it through thick and thin.With that in mind, we ask a team of Fool to highlight a stock in their portfolio that they plan to hang on to for the ultra-long term. Read on to see whi they pickedAlphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) ,Under Armour(NYSE: UA) (NYSE: UAA) , andStarbucks(NASDAQ: SBUX) .Imag source: Getti Images.makeArticleAd();Alphabet will continu to benefit from digit browsingJam Carnette, CFA(Alphabet): The market wasn't kind to Alphabet' recent report fourth-quart and full-year results. Overall, the compani continu to post enviabl growth rate for a compani of it scale. Alphabet increas revenu 20.4% over the previou year' results; on a quarterli basis, it grew revenu 22.2% over last year' correspond period. However, the company' fourth-quart bottom line increas by onli 8.3%, to $5.3 billion, as Alphabet' provis for incom tax increas by a massiv 450% over last year' correspond quarter, on account of a one-tim tax adjustment. Still, the fickl market sold off share to the tune of 2% becaus the compani miss analyst expectations.On a posit note, Alphabet confirm that mobil search is one of it highest-growth areas. The biggest shift in internet brows over the past five year ha been from desktop to mobile, and that move benefit Alphabet, consid Googl control approxim 95% of the mobile-search market.Th compani also continu to grow it advertis business. Earlier thi year, a shock report fromMorgan Stanleyanalyst Brian Nowak found that 85% of everi new dollar in onlin advertis wa go to just two companies: Alphabet andFacebook. As the shift to onlin advertis continues, look for Alphabet to continu to post strong revenu growth rates.Simpli put, Alphabet' long-term thesi remain intact. The compani is the largest digit advertis and search engin in the world, and Alphabet will onli continu to grow search and advertis revenu as internet usag increas from a combin of penetr and accessibility, while a push for digit advertis will boost the company' bottom line.Stil a believ in Under ArmourBrian Feroldi(Und Armour): The past six month haven't been kind to Under Armour' shareholders. The stock took a big hit inlat October, after manag ratchet back it long-term growth targets. More recently, share gotcrushedaft the compani report sale growth of just 12% in the all-import fourth quarter. Not onli wa that figur far shi of management' guidance, but the company' CFO also resign suddenly. That' a lot of bad news for investor to take in all at one time, so it wa no surpris to see that share took a big hit.However, a closer look at the quarter hint that investor shouldn't throw in the towel on thi growth stori just yet. While total sale growth wa disappointing, the biggest culprit wa slow sale in North America. That' understandable, as the retail environ statesid wa quit challeng for mani retail over the holidays. The recent bankruptci of The Sport Authority, Eastern Mountain Sports, Sport Chalet, Golfsmith, Citi Sports, and Bob' Store didn't help the matter, either.However, Under Armour' report did contain a hand of bright spots. Direct-to-consum sale -- which bypass retail altogeth -- jump by 23% and now account for nearli 40% of total sales. And footwear sale grew by a solid 36% year over year. Best of all, intern revenu grew by 55% and now compris 16% of total sales. These figur suggest that Under Armour' brand still remain strong.Whil the compani ha some near-term challeng to overcome, I have a hard time believ that thi growth stori is dead. As long as founder and CEO Kevin Plank is at the helm, thi is one stock I can't ever see myself part way with.Middle-class peopl love their coffee, and there' about to be a lot more of themJasonHall(Starbucks): The global coffe giant' stock is down around 8% sinc first-quart earn came out in late January, and not without some justification. After all, Starbuck report that traffic in it North American store wa pretti much flat in the quarter, a trend that start in 2016 and could continu through 2017. Furthermore, manag indic that it may feel the same way and is now project revenu growth between 8% and 10%, a reduct from origin full-year guidanc of 10% or greater at the end of the prior quarter.But Starbuck isn't the kind of compani that will scare me away with a minor flatten of growth in it most matur market -- especi not right now. Starbucks' best day could be ahead of it, even as Howard Schultz step down as CEO for the second time.To start with, Starbucks' growth opportun in Asia is simpli enormous. Within a decade, the middl class in China alon is like to be doubl the size of the U.S., and Starbucks' manag recent said it expect China to becom the company' biggest market. Here' a littl more context: At the start of 2017, Starbuck had nearli 16,000 store in the Americas, versu fewer than 6,800 in the China/Asia Pacif region, with 2,500 of those in China.Bottom line: Growth veri well could slow further -- or even stall -- in the company' more matur markets, but I won't sell. The global growth stori is onli get started, and that' go to drive decad of growth. I'm not miss out on that.10 stock we like better than Alphabet (C shares)When invest genius David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip, it can pay to listen. After all, the newslett they have run for over a decade,Motley Fool Stock Advisor, ha tripl the market.*David and Tom just reveal what they believ are the10 best stocksfor investor to buy right now... and Alphabet (C shares) wasn't one of them! That' right -- they think these 10 stock are even better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor return as of Januari 4, 2017Suzann Frey, an execut at Alphabet, is a member of The Motley Fool' board of directors.Brian Feroldiown share of Alphabet (A shares), Alphabet (C shares), Facebook, Starbucks, Under Armour (A Shares), and Under Armour (C Shares).Jam Carnetteown share of Alphabet (C shares) and Facebook.Jason Hallown share of Alphabet (A shares), Facebook, Starbucks, Under Armour (A Shares), and Under Armour (C Shares). The Motley Fool own share of and recommend Alphabet (A shares), Alphabet (C shares), Facebook, Starbucks, Under Armour (A Shares), and Under Armour (C Shares). The Motley Fool ha adisclosur policy.

column1: Xiaomi Was Going to Rival Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock — What Happened?
column3: InvestorPlaceInvestorPlac - Stock Market News, Stock Advic & Trade TipsOnli a few year ago,Xiaomiwa worryingAppl Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) investors. Xiaomi had becom the world' third-largest smartphon manufactur and wa expand into other product like fit trackers, TV and video streamers. It wa valu at $45 billion, hire a promin execut away fromAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOG, NASDAQ:GOOGL) Googl and plan an expans into America.makeArticleAd();Source: XiaomiToday? It ha drop out of the top five smartphon vendor list, marketshar in China ha plummeted, the Googl exec ha jump ship and some analyst are valu the compani as low as $3.6 billion.What happen to Xiaomi and is it threat to Appl truli neutralized? Or are the troubl Chines tech giant' plan mere on hold?Xiaomi' Rapid RisePriv held Xiaomi wa found in 2010, releas it first smartphon in 2011 and rapidli gain popular in China. The compani offer high-qual in it smartphones, with low price -a combin that led to it be the top-sel smartphon brand in China by 2014.It came seemingli out of nowher to captur thethird place spot for worldwid smartphon salesthat year as well. The feat wa especi impress given that Xiaomi wa not sell it phone in the U.S. market.9 Best Cheap Stock to Buy Now Under $9.99Like Apple, Googl andSamsung Electron Co Ltd(OTCMKTS:SSNLF), the compani want to expand into consum electron in general. That effort includ the inexpens Mi Band fit tracker that vault Xiaomi intosecond place worldwid for wearabl salesbi 2015, behind onlyFitbit Inc(NYSE:FIT).Th compani pursu a strategi of invest in hardwar startups, buy into dozen of compani make everyth from smart light to headphon and TVs. While these product are not alway Xiaomi-branded, they are design to all work well together.It also ad softwar and servic to the mix.Chines CompetitionTh success of Xiaomi spur homegrown competition. Other Chines manufactur step up to the plate and follow Xiaomi' formula. However, they did a better job of market to increasingli demand Chines consum by charg a littl more but offer more strike designs. One of these compani -Huawei- wa good enough that Googlepartn with it to build the Nexu 6P smartphon in 2015. Xiaomi' phone seem lower qualiti than these competitor and rather than innovative, it design are often seen as be too similar to Apple's.At thi point, Xiaomi ha been leapfrog by it Chines smartphon rivals. While Xiaomi ha drop off the global top five smartphon manufactur list, China' Huawei,OppoandVivocurr hold the third, fourth and fifth places.American ObstaclesKey to Xiaomi' ambit were an expans into the U.S. market. To lead that effort, thecompani hire Hugo Barra- the VP who oversaw Android product manag - from Google.However, Xiaomi' U.S. push ha fail to materialize. There are dozen of product Xiaomi offer onlin through itsMi Store(which carri onli a fraction of Xiaomi' and it partner companies' gear), includ eight differ smartphon models, multipl smart TVs, VR headset and even a self-balanc electr scooter. U.S. custom are limit to be abl to buy a few set of earbuds, a pair of headphones, a batteri pack and a Bluetooth speaker.A big part of the problem in move into the U.S. market is that Xiaomi ha taken advantag of China' rel lax approach to patents. In late 2014, it wasban from sell smartphon in Indiaa a result of a patent infring rule (it ha sinc resum Indian operations). If Xiaomi tri to push into the U.S. with it smartphon at thi point, there' a good chanc Appl and other tech compani would sue it into oblivion.In an attempt to defend against thi scenario, Xiaomi ha begun buy up patents. Last year,it purchas 1,500 patentsfromMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) relat to area like wireless communication, multimedia and video, and the cloud.No Longer a Threat to Apple?At thi point, Xiaomi is a paper tiger that isvalu at as littl as $3.6 billion. column1: How Profitable Is SpaceX, Really?
column3: Last year, prior to the big SpaceXplos -- which kind of knockedSpaceX off the rails-- we spent a lot of time dig into SpaceX' finances. We asked:How doe SpaceX make money? And we answer the question: "How profit is SpaceX" when it make all that money?Much of thi wa base on educ guesswork, however, as we extrapol what we knew about the financ at SpaceX rivalsBoeing(NYSE: BA) ,Lockhe Martin(NYSE: LMT) ,Orbit ATK(NYSE: OA) , andAirbus(NASDAQOTH: EADSY) , and appli it to what wethoughtthat might mean for SpaceX' own finances. The number aren't entir clear from theJournal' chart, but appear to show SpaceX earn an oper profit of perhap 0.2% on $1 billion in revenu -- profit far below the 10%-ish profit margin that Boe earn on it space operations, or the 12.6% oper profit margin at Lockhe Martin.That bleak situat got even wors in 2015 when a small reduct in launch revenu suffic to push SpaceX deepli into the red, and forc the compani to record a $260 million loss on $945 million in revenue.What SpaceX hope to earnSpaceX'ssuccess return to spacelast month hold forth the promis that thing will improv in 2017. Prior to the Septemb SpaceXplosion, document show that SpaceX wa target $1.8 billion in launch revenu in 2016, and aim to earn $55 million in profit thereon. While it probabl didn't get there in 2016, there' still a chanc that it could succeed in 2017 -- and achiev a 3% oper profit margin.And that' your answer right there: Currently, all indic suggest that SpaceX isnotprofitable, but lose money. Onli if thing go well, and SpaceX regain it foot in 2017, can we hope that the compani will achiev posit oper profit margin of 3%.Even if SpaceX succe at this, though, it would still be earn onli roughli half the 5.7% oper margin that Airbu earn at it "Defenc and Space" busi (a report byS&P Global Market Intelligence). SpaceX' target $55 million profit would also be a small fraction of the $400 million in annual profit that the Boe and Lockhe joint ventur ULAearns. On the other hand, SpaceX would eclips thebreak-even profitsat Airbus' dedic space launch subsidiary, Arianespac -- and SpaceX could grow it profit margin in the futur if it plan to begin reus reland rockets, at lower cost than use "expendable" rockets, pan out.SpaceX 2.0: A New HopeSo what' the upshot for SpaceX for investor who hope to one day invest in it IPO, and for investor who already,today, own a piec of SpaceX through their invest inAlphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) stock? Simpli put, the document theJournalunearth show that SpaceX is not nearli as profit an oper as we onc believ it to be..There' also a corollari conclusion, though, that affect investor in the space industri in general. Lack substanti profit from it launch business, SpaceX is go to have a veri hard time financ atrip to Mars-- a voyag it hope to makea earli as next year-- and a voyag that could inspir a whole host of other compani to acceler their own race to space.HowdoesSpaceX plan to fund it first trip to Mar in 2018 and the dozen of follow-up trip it hope to make in the year and decad to follow? column1: 1 Thing NVIDIA Investors Should Worry About
column3: WhenIntel(NASDAQ: INTC) acquir artifici intellig (AI) start-up Nervana System late last year, at first glanc it appear to be anoth big tech compani jump on the AI bandwagon. A closer look, however, reveal a veri specif motivation. And it could spell troubl for NVIDIA.NVIDIA GPU is the go-to chip to train AI system -- for now. It announc it ha a Tensor Process Unit -- which is also an ASIC -- capabl of deliv perform that is 10 time faster than ani GPU run today, and that it ha been run TPU in it data center for more than a year. They were also use in the AI system Alpha Go, which recent made headlin bydef mani top rankedGoplayers. Thi provid a degre of confirm of Nervana' claim regard the potenti of such custom circuits.NVIDIA see AI as a billion-dollar opportunity, though data center revenu amount to onli $240 million in it most recent quarter. Intel' revenu from data centers, meanwhile, amount to $4.7 billion in it most recent quarter. Thi illustr that while gain in the market would bare move the needl for Intel, they could be a big mover for NVIDIA. column1: How Social Media Changed Super Bowl Commercials Forever
column3: In these time of deep polit division, America' great unifi is visibl on the horizon. Regardless of your partisan identity, race, ethnicity, or religion, if you live in the Unit States, you are probabl go to watch the 51stannual Super Bowl thi Sunday. Heck, even if you hate football, it is a great excus to have some friend over and gorg yourself with French onion dip and potato chips.But what is more American than apathet bing eating? Well, commerci of course! As if viewer were not satisfi with an hour-long, ultra-viol faceoff between the world' top athletes, the Super Bowl is tradit pair with interest and uniqu commerci to ensur that we do not take our eye off the televis for one second.It make sens that a compani would want to put their best advertis out dure the Super Bowl; the big game is alway the most-watch televis event of the year in the U.S., and base on last year' 112 million viewers, we can expect more than a third of the entir countri to be tune in on Sunday.(Also Read:51 Essenti Houston Fact to Get You Readi for Super Bowl LI)With that said, the advertis industri as a whole is not what it onc was. Over the past decad or so, advertis have been forc to adapt to new consum behaviors, and that ha meant the rise of viral market and digit ad campaigns.Sup Bowl commerci have not been immun from these changes. Viewer simpli do not want to miss ani of the big commercials, and with plenti of trip to the fridg and bathroom on the averag Super Bowl watcher' schedule, compani have start use the internet as a mean of distribut their Super Bowl ads.Whil it is noth new for Super Bowl spot to begin widespread circul after the game itself, the latest phenomena ha been the pre-releas of commerci befor the actual event. Mani compani are now debut their Super Bowl ad more than a week out from the game and pair their releas with a massiv social media market campaign.Indeed, the rise of social media ha coincid with an adapt Super Bowl commerci tradition. These days, compani want peopl to buzz about their commerci well befor they are set to debut. In fact, a recentNew York Timesarticlehighlight the fact that compani are spend even more money for onlin market on top of the cost of air the commerci dure the game.Mari Scott, a presid at sport and entertain market agenc UEG, toldTh Timesthat she recommend client spend at least 25% of the cost of the Super Bowl spot on their digit market rollout of the commercial.Th cost of a 30-second advertis dure thi year' Super Bowl rose to an astound $5 million, and that mean compani will want to get the most valu for their investment. "There' becom more of a game around the game in term of ensur that realli pay off in a big way," said Scott."Th game around the game" that Scott is refer to includ massiv social media exposur to the commerci in advanc of the Super Bowl. For instance, a compani may upload the spot to YouTub befor spread it around FacebookFBand TwitterTWTR.Soci media also give consum new way to react to the advertisements. Discuss about the spot play out online, and it doe not take much for these massiv compani to becom trend topics. Furthermore, Alphabet Inc.GOOGLi celebr 10 year of YouTube' AdBlitz competition, a vote system that allow user to support their favorit spots.Som may argu that the pre-gam debut ruin some of the fun relat to watch the Super Bowl, but if I point you to our piec that highlight some of the commerci that are alreadi out, are you serious not go to watch them? You are, and you can check them out here:Preview The Super Bowl Commerci That Are Alreadi Out.Person speaking, I am happi about thi trend. I plan on have some peopl over for the game thi year, and it is alway difficult to get peopl to stay quiet dure the commercials, especi when the drink start get finished. I will be check out as mani as I can beforehand.Long-Term Buy You Won't See in the NewsTh stock you see in today' headlin may not be in the news tomorrow or next week.
